metadata.title: CVE-2016-2806 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the browser engine in MozillaFirefox before 46.0 and Firefox ESR 45.x before 45.1 allow remote attackersto cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) orpossibly execute arbitrary code via unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2806` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 46.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 46.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 46.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 46.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '46.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
